text: EarthhopKellerMuffStyle!!! Oder einfach nur A Lil Quadrupel !? üòâ Egal. Brotig, ankaramelt und durchaus w√ºrzsweet. Nettes BRD Ale...Direkt aus D√ºsseldorf. 0,33l Buddel.
Klares r√∂tliches Bernstein mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, R√∂staromen, leicht fruchtig, nussig, w√ºrzig, sehr s√ºffig.
Bottle in Holy Craft, Dusseldorf. Brown with a big frothy cream head. Nice toasty aroma. The taste is big toast and toffee with some subtle citrus too. Very good.

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy, light mahogany with a quickly disappearing head. The aroma is lightly yeasty (dough) and lightly malty (caramel). Medium body with a low carbonation, a light sweetness and a medium bitterness. The flavor is malty with bread, caramel, honey, some fruits and a bitter hoppy dry finish.

bottle, hazy, very dark amber, offwhite head.
odour: dough, yeast, some raisins, honey, 
flavour: metallic, very dry, medium bitterness, malty, lightly warming (effect alcohol)
Clear deep amber with a medium off white head. Aroma had toasted malt with roasted malt. Flavor had toasted malt and floral hops. Finished bitter.

Bottle. Clear amber, dense white head. 
Pumpernickel, dried figs. 
NIce acidity, fresh, slightly toasted, well balanced, nearly no noticeable sweetness, medium bodied, a faint bitter aftertaste.

300ml bottle at RedHot Munich. Aroma is malt, oats. Appearance is dark brown with a brown-ish foam. Taste is light sweet and bitter with a bitter aftertaste. Palate is dry and wirh a light carbonation. Very nice.

0.33l bottle thanks to Cristobal37. Slightly hazy dark orange body with a white head. Aroma of bread, grains, orange zest, toffee and floral hops. Taste of bread, orange zest, butter, roasted malts and floral hops. Decent beer.
Bottle, a bit of a gusher. Hazy brown, muddy water. Roasted malt, black tea, doughy basement aroma. Smooth dry bitter finish. Much better than the plain Uerige, but not very complex.
Bottle at home. Pours deep orange brown, nose is earthy, pine, toffee, taste is sweet, chewy, light fruit, stick toffee.

Pours light reddish-brown with a thin offwhite head. Aroma is hoppy. Taste is bitter with a touch of sweetness. There are notes of earthy hops up front along with a bit of nutty malt and red fruit and musty yeast. Body is light with medium-low carbonation. It¬ís a bit like an extra hoppy English bitter with some continental yeastiness. Very interesting!
Bottle at home, 24th February 17. Pours brown, aroma is slight sour, hops, cararmel, malt. Taste is malt, caramel, some slight sour, hops. Pretty tasty.

quite light-colored head, dark brown color, clear, fruity hop-aromas, tastes like a mix of a modern pale ale and the regular altbier-style, also some fruity yeast-flavors i can make out. not my taste. my bottle says alc. 6,0% vol

Aroma is caramel, earthy hops, malt, bready, bitter, slightly metallic. Appearance is brownish red, off white to light tan head, somewhat hazy. Taste is bitter, malt, bready, earthy hops, not as much caramel as I expected, definitely more bitter than sweet. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, bitter malt and earthy hop aftertaste. Overall, this is good but I prefer the Doppel Sticke.
Bottle. Orangey Amber. Very malty (buttery, caramelly). Roasty (burnt sugar). Sour fruit (berries). Earthy, woody flavours. Sweetish leading to dry bittering hop finish. (2008)

Bottle, 11.2 fl.oz, 6%abv. Kindly given by my SecretSanta2016 Zlotta ! A brown mahogany opaque beer with a medium white head ; ok retention. Roast, light dried fruits, red berries note, light biscuit. Light to medium sweet, light dry lasting bitter refreshing. Medium body, light to medium texture, average to soft carbonation, sweet fruity finish. Overall, good !
Wood and maple syrup aroma. Hazy brown, thin tan head. Wood and maple syrup, caramel. Medium body, easy carbonation.

Bottle at home. From Wine Rack, West Byfleet. Caramel/grassy aroma but low on the dial. Dark amber, verging on opaque. Creamy if thin off-white head. Light bitter. Develops a citric sourness. Medium bodied. Soft. Carbonation. Dry finish, with a touch of the astringent. Less going on than the standard Alt I just had, but perhaps best described as more refined. A more balanced taste and I prefer the palate. There¬ís even some warmth in finish from the additional ABV.

Farbe: braun
Schaum: gut best√§ndig leicht s√§mig
Nase: leicht ger√∂steter Malz ziemlich fruchtig! So nach getrockneten Feigen, Karamell.
Geschmack: Vollmundig schon von vorne herein, ohne √ºberm√§√üig s√º√ü und schwer zu sein. Wobei so etwas bockig ist es schon vor allem der schwer-malzige Nachgeschmack. Angenehm in S√§ure und Bitterkeit. Runder Abgang dann dominiert der r√∂st-karamellmalz.
Echt nicht schlecht, eine Entdeckung! War mir bisher nicht so klar was die in D√ºsseldorf so draufhaben. Schade dass es das in Bayern kaum wo gibt.

Bottle. Caramel, toasted, nutty notes, subtle toffee, fresh red fruit (apples, cherries). Soft mouthfeel, slightly sticky, dry finish. Robust body, malty and fruity flavour. Light to medium bitterness with notes of grass. Excellent drinkability.
Bottle - 6.0% alc. - dark brown color, small beige head. Notes of roasted dark bread, malts, slightly fruity. Nice dry finish. Great.

Bottle. Red brown color with a medium frothy tan head. Fruity nose, citrus and grapes along with roasted note and a touch of caramel. Medium bitter taste, light balancing sweetness. Medium carbonation and body. Flavor is fruity and hoppy as well, stronger malt notes, roasted and caramel and a touch of sherry and dark fruits. Bitter dry and warming finish. Light aftertaste, bitter and fruity.
Dark brown with thin head. Aroma and flavour have light caramel and nutty malts. Quite full flavoured. Pleasantly dry in the finish.

Bottle, to celebrate my 4th anniversary of joining RateBeer. Pours hazy dark copper brown with very little in the way of a head, just som off-white bubbles on the surface. Clear aroma of malt and yeast, with fruity hints and touches of caramel. Dusty and estery flavour with notes of malt and hops and touches of fruit. Mild, dusty and estery aftertaste with acidic hints. Very low carbonation. Not bad at all, just surprisingly flat.

Bottle, 6.0%. Malty aroma, syrupy and slightly fruity. Hazy dark brown colour. Small creamy white head. The flavour is malty with a weak caramelly note and a slightly spicy hoppiness. A little watery for the ABV, and also a thin mouthfeel.
Shared with wim at his home. Hazy brown colored beer with small white head and lots of carbonation. Malty fruited aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is malty bitter.

Very nice bottle but without information about the drinktemperature.
A dark-brown beer with a cream-colored head, malty, roasty, good balance betweeN sweetness and bitterness, medium body, flat carbonation, like a barrel aged,
(I have 0.33l bottle with batch L11316 and best-before 04.17)

Look: dark brown with red shades, cloudy, unstable white head.

Aroma: malty, slighlty roasted. some dark fruits.
Taste: almost dry, with light fruity sourness and spicy bitterness.
Flavour: malt, dark candied fruits, wine, some grassy and spicy hops.
Hop become more prominent in the finish.

Good.
Draught at Gourmet Haus Stadt in Redwood City. Old score. Moderately rich malt and clear copper with smallish white head.
At Home along with Yves hazy brown colored body with a white head and a spicy floral malt hops aroma a spicy herby hops yeast fruity bitter sweet taste with a bitter finish

Aroma: nice hoppy aroma, roasted, melanoidins.
Appearance: hazy amber color and thin white head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, melanoidins, herbal notes, roasted malts, quite dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, cellar finish.
Overall: Really nice sticke, really drinkable and balanced.

Many thanks for my Uncle who take me and find this place in Dusseldorf. Small Swing-Top bottle buy in Dusseldort at the Brewery in late Autumn 2015y. Wow co za gigantyczna i trwala piana. Niesamowity zapach sliwek i octu balsamicznego. Ciemno rubinowe piwo, poteznie metne. W smaku wytrawne, owocowo beszamelowe, troche dojrza≈Çych wisni, nieco karmelu ale bardzo, bardzo niewiele i ta super swierzosc chmielna. Czuc go juz przy glosnym wystrzeleniu krachli. Zadymilo jak ze starej syrenki. Bardzo zlozone i zroznicowane piwo w moim odbiorze. Ci co wielbia nachmielone IPA a gardzo Altem ze wzgledu na karmelowa slodycz chyba opili sie Diebelsem i mysla ze to synonim Alta. Sa w bledzie bo Uerige Alt jest super rzemieslniczym piwem i lamiacym wszelkie reguly stylu. Super jakosc i zroznicowany smak. Polecam, najlepiej w browarze.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2016 From the bottle poured into Spiegelau IPA Glass. Nose of malts and typical uerige yeast. Slightly floral and some alcoholic hints. Taste is slightly bitter, hints of bubblegum and alcohol kind of sweetish middlepart and overall low carbonation. Malty herbal hoppy finish... Good... (bottle aged for six months at 7 degree Celsius)

Bottle thanks to Bursprak! Pours hazy orange/brown with an off white head. Aroma of bready yeast, fresh baked bread, sweet malts, weak cake and some old hops. The taste has what, slight tart notes, dry grains, sweet malts and bready yeast. Alright!
Bottle. Brownish amber-colored beer with light creamy foam. Aroma: apple, candy, a little wine and noble hops, caramel malt. Taste: caramel, wine, dried fruit, candy, light hop bitterness. Not bad.

Bottle @Les Vignerons (Rome). Pours amber with a medium off-white head. Aroma is malty (biscuit) with hops notes, grassy, earthy and little citrusy. Flavour is medium malty sweetness leading to a decent bitter end. Medium body, medium carbonation. Not my cup of tea.

Dark clear amber colour. Medium white round of froth on top. Hints of berries, hints of citrusses, caramel in the aroma. Hints of berries and caramel at first. Hints of citrusses and honey in the middle. Some bitterness, hints of berries in the end. Sour aftertaste.
Bottle from Hopfen & Maltz, Berlin. Dirty brownish pour with a tan head. Notes of yeast, orange, grains, caramel and some light tar.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours a darkish, hazy brown with a small white head. Aroma smells like an old, english ipa; old hops, malty, light caramel, fruity, bready, overripe orange, yeast. Taste is somewhat sweet, hoppy bitter, light bready dry. Medium high carbonation, light to oily body.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours muddy dark brown with a small white head. Aroma is malty, old yeasty, old hops, earthy, orange, dark fruits. Taste is old hoppy, malty, orange, citrussy, earthy, yeasty, dark fruits.

Butelka 0,33 l 03/2017. Kolor ciemny bursztyn. Pianka drobna lecz szybko uciekaj√§ca. Zapach suszonych owoc√≥w palonego karmelu i toffi. Smak wanilia, lekko pieprzowe, sk√≥rka chlebowa srodek dosc goryczkowy. Ogolnie charakter przypominajacy troche sherry i barrique. Stary to fantastyczne Stare Piwo.
Had on draft at Hopcat Detroit. Pours brown with a small head, big malty aroma. Medium light mouthfeel. Malty flavor, dry, with some lingering bitterness nice beer!

Murky brown, dense and persistent off-white head. Intense aroma of caramel, hazelnuts, dark fruits; a hint of tea-like bitterness. More of the same in the taste, with a strong bitter finish and aftertaste. Very complex. Thin mouthfeel, expecially for the ABV, somehow still manages to unfold a wide range of flavours. Dry finish. Interesting, complex, yet quite easily drinkable

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Dark amber with light beige head. Aromas of malt, light dark fruit, caramel, biscuit, toast, some wheat. Tastes of malt, caramel, light toast, biscuit. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
Golden brown color, beige head. Caramel nose, malty, prunes, hint of licorice. Brown sugar taste, caramel, malty, moderate sweetness, hints of dried fruit and coffee. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Aroma is really nice. The bottle had a solid pop when it opened and immediately there was a definite aroma of toffee. Head was thick, creamy and fairly long lasting. The rest of the aroma was roast, dark malt. Flavor¬ís only slightly similar to nose as the strong carbonation dominates. Same for body. This would have been so much better, if not for the heavy carbonation. Still, a very good beer. Easy drinking.

Flasche von drnosha, √ºberhaupt eine sch√∂ne Optik der Flasche, dunkles Braun sch√∂ner cremiger Schaum, frischer malziger Geruch leichte Muskatnuss, frischer Geschmack gr√ºner Apfel Malz caramell, herber Abgang dehr rundes Bier

Wundersch√∂ne 0,33l B√ºgel-Relief Flasche. Dunkelbraunes Altbier mit viel feinem hellem Schaum. Frischer Duft nach Malz, Harz und etwas Apfel. Sehr runder Geschmack. Trockenpflaume, Malz und Honig. Angenehm bitteres Finish. Hervorragendes Alt!
Hervorragendes Bier, DAS perfekte Alt. Fruchtig, malzig, ganz sanft. Trotz 6,0% sehr s√ºffig. Dominanter, sch√∂ner Geschmack.Viel Pflaume und Honig.K√∂stlich!
Dark brown. Aroma of toasted malt. Bitter with hints of caramel and fruits. Well balanced. Another masterpiece of the Uerige brewery.

Pours a cloudy amber beer with a small beige head.
Smells of caramel, malts, some yeast.
Tastes malty, sweet.
Leaves a gentle sweet palate.
Fine sweet crowd pleasing beer.

Bottle, big gushing bubbly fluffy light beige head with lots of lacing, clear deep copper color, bread and caramel flavor with fruity and flowery hints, biscuity flavor with some fruity notes and a strong and empathic herbal bitterness. Good satisfying Alt.

This is another old-world quality beer. You can taste the centuries of beer-making in a brew like this. Flawless and nuanced....not at all in your face or gaudy like American craft brewed beer. This is malty and smooth, with just the right hint of dry hoppiness at the finish. Nice.

0,33l Flasche. Braunes Bier mit fester beiger Schaumkrone. Riecht malzig und leicht nach reifen Fr√ºchten. Schmeckt nach R√∂stmalzen und unterschiedlichem Aromahopfen, beides ist wunderbar abgestimmt. Komplex mit tollen Geschmacksnuancen.
330ml bottle. Cooper color with one finger head. Caramel and earthy taste and aroma. Pretty good.
Bottle from Gourmet Haus Staudt in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is mineral water, metallic dark malts, raisins. Taste is thin, watered-down earthy malts. Not nearly as good as the Uerige Doppel Sticke.
Brown color with little foam. The smell has a lot of earthy and foresty hoppy bitterness. The taste is mild hoppy and a little malty with a calm aftertaste.

Sample courtesy of a friend. 
Thin creamy white head. Hazy amber pour. Nice easy drinking alt
Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Nice aroma hops, texture and taste of a soft barley wine, but far less sweet or sticky. Rather dry actually.
Amber-brown color with big tan head. Aroma is toffee, hoppy, caramel, plums. Taste similar, with bitter caramel, also spicy yeasts. Rich. Yup, mini Barleywine is quite accurate. Good stuff!

L:
-pours a hazy copper-brown with a medium, creamy,beige head
-medium to high carbonation visible
S:
-caramel,toffee,floral,rummy,perfumy, fruits
T:
Cherries,plums,raisins,figs,toffee,pea fruits
-medium bitterniss for the style
F:
-medium to high carbonation
-medium body
O:
-Just great.Almost like a Mini Barleywine

Bottled 14.05.
Murkey tan, with a vibrant amber hue. 20-22 srm. Big bubbly off white head, tons of co2 pop. 
Root beer/Coke cheery sweetness, tootsie roll, European barnyard hay. Motts apple sauce.
Pretty mild taste, light flavor like an esb without the heavy bitterness.
Dry, no real lingering finish.
K√òLF 200215. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, yeast, hop. flavour is caramel, yeast, hop, sugar, grain, grass. OK beer.

Poprs with a thick head and with good carbonation
Aroma: fruits, malt and nuts
Taste: spices, malt, some fruits quite nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle from Les Vignerons. Dark amber, light copper, perfectly clear, with a huge, fluffy, forever lasting off white head. Milions of bubbles streaming up. Fruity, malty and nutty nose, notes of caramel malts, hazelnuts, toffee, subtle reminiscene of baked apples and candied peaches. Taste pretty much follow suite with a little difference, there is a mild warming sensation despite no actual alchool smell in the aroma. Again caramel, slightly astringent sweetness, moderate but lingering malty and toasted bitterness. Lighter mouthfeel than what I was expecting. Average carbonation, light to medium body, slightly oily texture. I¬ím not a huge fan of Altbiers but this one was good, even if I¬ím afraid a fresher bottle would be so much better.

Bottle from VP Aker Brygge enjoyed at home
Pours hazy brown with a thick creamy tanned head. Smell of light fruits, some caramel and malts, hay and spices. Moderate sweet, quite spicy, fruity malts and yeast influence, caramel, some toffee, playful and interesting. Great stuff from Uerige!

0,33 l bottle from REWE Budnik & Homberg, bottled in 10/2014. Clear, reddish amber with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Lovely, fruity aroma of prunes, raisins, red berries, toffee and molasses, a little vinous in the end. Sweetish taste of raisins, prunes, nuts and caramel, followed by a nice and hoppy, slightly bitter, but also gently fruity finish. Medium body, smooth and oily mouthfeel, very soft carbonation. Overall very aromatic and tasty, with a pleasant mouthfeel. Richer than the standard Uerige, I really enjoyed it!

Bottle. Clear amber with a thick creamy head. Aroma of malt, caramel, honey and herbs. Sweetish malty start, caramel, biscuit, light fruitiness, strong herbal hops bitterness. Medium bodied, dry but quite smooth mouthfeel. Decent.
Pours a cloudy nutty Brown, slightly tan head. Aroma is Rich and malty, nutty, hay and bread.Taste is complex, nuts, bread, slightly roasted finish.

Really solid beer all around. Deeper hazelnut pour with an off white head. Nose is rich bready malts, toast and caramel, a little nutty and lightly sweet. Smooth. Flavor had all of those qualities with plenty of bread notes with moderate noble hops throughout, some herbal notes and light zest with light spice character. Lighter medium body, smooth and drinkable. Well made.

Bottle, 330ml. Pours dark brown with alight copper tint. Head is very short, thin and light colored, it is also very short lasting. Aroma of hops and some malt, quite weak as expected with the due to lack of head. Body is quite light with gentle carbonation. Tastes quite bitter and mostly dry, with very slight sweetness that is overshadowed by the bitterness. Flavors of citrusy hops, dry hops, dark not sweet malt flavors, some caramel, some roasted notes, some vanilla. Ends slightly sweet and sticky with strong hoppy after taste. OK, but not really balanced and quite boring actually. Bitterness is strong and would be nicer with more a more complex hop profile and some more sweetness or carbonation.

330ml bottle bought at Vinmonopolet Tromsdalen. Slim neck and a swing-top that gave a good shot when opened. Pours a cloudy caramel brown body topped by a rocky, beige head with fine retention and spotty lacing to the glassware. Just plain malt-driven aroma, hints of nuts and bread, mid-sweet. Well blended flavour character of earthy malts, nuts, herbal hops, and lightly hints of jam-like fruits. Malt bitterness to a prolonged ending. Fine bodied. Lovely. Had not expected this, it really came as a very pleasant surprise (Troms√∏ 27.03.2015).

Light tan top on near clear copper¬íish body, some mats and broad belts as lacing.
Aroma; mild mild malts, dough, mild grass and dust.
Taste; strong brown malts, syrup, grassy hops, malted candies, fruity notes, 
Fine body, normal carbonation. Brown chocolate¬íish finish, including fruity hops. 
The brew came out quite well after that very pale aroma at first.

Hazy mahogany color, very unique with a spongy head. Aroma very sweet and caramely, rich and almost sugary. Taste full and a little sharp, with strong caramel note and possibly some oxidation. Dry-ish finish with a bit of a sharpe note to it and some metallic feel.

33cl shared by Arve_Christian - thanks! Pours caramel coloured with a modest off-white head. Malty and caramelly aroma with some fruity and almost vinous notes. Sweet, but balanced with nice malty flavours and quite modest bitterness. Tasty and enjoyable.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Norway( on order). Dark brown color, good foam. Medium aroma intensity; malt, dried fruits & light notes of honey. Medium body & complexity . Quite sweet, balances ok. Enjoyable - although a bit sweet

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 330ml. Cloudy copper with medium creamy beige head and lots of particles. Aroma of sour fruits, notes of herbs and jojoba. The flavor starts with light sweet maltiness and afterwards gets very sour, with notes of jojoba and lemon, citrusy hops and a bit grassy, long lasting sour finish. Moderate carbonation, light to medium-bodied. Very interesting beer.

Bottle thanks to potjebier. Deep copper brown pour with thin off white head. Aroma is really rich and matly, tons of toasty aromas, light toffee, caramelized sugar, as in maillard effect. Taste is sweet but not cloying, rich toasty malty notes, light grassy bitterness. Palate is med-full bodied with med carbonation. Tasty.

Dark amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, dark fruit, some caramel, & spice; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, spicy hops, caramel, nuts, some dark fruit, and raisons; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Quite good - though I enjoyed their double more.

Bottle. Pours a deep amber-hued hazy brown body with a substantial creamy off-white head. Nose is raisins, grains, bread dough, caramel and hints of nuts and dark syrup. Taste is raisins, grains, cereals, bread dough, caramel and hints of figs, grass and dark syrup. Medium to full body, soft to medium carbonation. Very pleasant Altbier, malty and full of dark fruits but still balanced in sweetness somehow. Most enjoyable.

Bottle received in Euroswap 1, 2015. Pours very hazy deep hazel brown with a frothy beige head that leaves some sparse lacing and trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty, slightly floral, slightly earthy and tiny estery with dark bread, crispbread, caramel, cereal, hay, moist soil, pear skins and lemon peal. Taste is tiny sweet, bitter, malty, floral, earthy and tiny estery with dark bread, caramel, toasted cereal, hay, moist soil, minerals, lemon peal and hints of pear skins. Mouthfeel is soft, slightly viscous, round, tiny astringent, very tiny boozy and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with dark bread, caramel, cereal, hay, moist soil, minerals, pear skins, lemon peal and hints of alcohol. Not like anything I¬íve ever tried before but I like it. Even the slight pear eaters work in this brew. Very well made and tasty malt forward ale...

Pours a dark red turning brown with a small head. Aroma is nice and malty with a slight roastyness to it, with some slight spicy notes from the hops.
Flavor is earthy, malty, slightly nutty and roasty with a nice herbal finish. When the beer warms up you get more dark fruits and even more nuttiness. It¬ís a really interesting brew. I¬íd definately try it again!

Bottle. Pours dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, brown sugar, some caramel and grains. Flavor is sweet and malty with some caramel, biscuits and herbs. Medium body, average carbonation.
Dunkel m√∏rk brun farve med lys beige skum. Lukt av m√∏rk malt, frukt og krydder. Smak av m√∏rk malt, frukt og krydder.

Utseende: Grumset brun farge.

Fruity flavour of malts, caramel, hops, grass and citrus with notes of grape fruits.
Hoppy finish.

Looks pretty awsome, and beeing one of the best in its style I kind of havee been looking forward to dick in to this Altbeer. Dark amber/brownish pour ..... off white creamy head .... caramel malt and earthy aroma with some floral hop ..... taste of caramel and earthy with light bitterness ... nutty and roasted malts also in there .... very good brew aged nicely

Bottle at home. Pours a clear dark copper with a diminishing off-white head. Very bitter with an underlying sweetness. Strong hops aromas. Also tiny hints of metals and soy sauce towards the end and in the finish. Medium to full bodied. Medium carbonation. Lond bitter finish.

Tap at Ginger Man. Pours amber with a soft, white head. Nose holds some earthy hops, along with hints of lightly toasted malts. Flavor is mildly sweet, with some caramel malts, along with some hints of fruit and earthiness. Medium in body and well carbonated. Finish is outrageously dry. An interesting - and pretty good - beer.

In bottle at 1904 Brewhouse.  Appearance was medium brown with a thin layer of blotchy suds.  Nose was nice with pleasant fruit, light roasted effects, and malt.  Flavor was pretty much like the aroma.  Delightful.

Bottle. Deep ruby colour with a medium-sized beige head. The aroma is nutty malt and some floral hops. Medium-bodied and very smooth mouthfeel. The flavour is malty with notes of nuts, caramel and floral hops. Very good.

Bottled 33cl. Surprisingly inviting hop presence in the nose. Great balance between hops and malt throughout. Raisins showing up. Good bitterness. Dry finish. Tasty, delicious, very nicely brewed with a huge amount of character. A gem.
Golden color, medium white head.  Aroma of nuts and caramel.  Taste is very malty.  Straightforward.
Pours a huge tan head which diminishes quickly.  The color is a cloudy dark brown, with plenty of bubbles.  The body is really good.  The taste is that of a fairly hoppy ale.
Black lager tastes and feels generically "wet" with some mild hoppiness. Pretty bland overall. Rated 8/3/09

Bottled (from bierkompass.de). Deep rubyish amber colour, mediumsized brown head. Aroma is some caramel malts, crisp bisquits, some nuttyness as well as mildly toasted notes. Flavour is quite floral and grassy hops along with some earth and also mild notes of caramel and alcohol. Also some mild notes of fruityness. Also some mild chocolaty notes in the finish. A very nice strong Alt.

text: (bottle) pours a hazy copper-ruby colour with a frothy dense beige head. aroma of bread, cherries and strawberries, caramel, herbs and light gingerbread spice. flavour is the same, though less fruity, with a long yeasty caramel bitter finish. medium body with smooth carbonation.

11.2 fl oz (thanks to Jessica). This was a great choice! Mellow notes on the aroma, yet very pleasant. Nutty German cookies is what comes to mind. Also, some caramel, light citrus, earthy grass, buttered rolls, and a light herbal spice. A gorgeous beer as well. Huge creamy ivory colored head, nice retention and lacing, a cloudy, mostly opaque, fiery copper colored body. With the taste, a medium full feel, quite smooth and buttery with just enough crisp punch.  A zesty grass permeates through out and lingers nicely past the finish with nice cookie malts to balance it out. Also, light citrus, caramel, and lightly nutty cereal grains. Overall, a very drinkable beer, that I feel would work great at anytime of the year, not just the two dates described. Would definitely be a go to beer if in Germany and it were available year round.

11.2 oz bottle.  Pours murky copper brown in color with a thin white head, leaving lots of lace.  Aroma is complex, lots of fruit, tobacco, and grassy hops.  This beer is very malty, medium body, nice citrus note, and a smooth malty, sweet finish.
bottle - hazy brownish beer with a thin off-white head. Nice hops aroma. Reminds on IPA. Some grapefruit. Flavour is bitter, some sourness. Not like a "modern" Alt. Lively carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2010 Bottle. Complex and highly drinkable masterpiece! The aroma has got some overpowering malts, and also more hops than i would have expected. Complex taste of dark, dark syrup and mighty mighty malt. The aftertaste has got some citrus hops and a smoked malt bitterness. Well balanced and smooth.

[bottle from Bierkompass.de]
Potent caramel toffee aroma with some brown sugar and significant grapefruit hops. Hazy dark bronze covered by a thin, off-white sheet. Spicy caramel flavour with some pleasant sourness and strong bitterness that is in good balance with the sugary caramel/toffee. Notes of bitter grapefruit and dried fruit. Medium body, moderate carbonation, moderately bitter finish.

11.2 oz bottle pours a dark, rich tobacco brown with a good bit of retaining off white head.  Aroma of bready malts, floral sweetness, earthy (almost metallic), dash of spice.  Light taste profile with bready sweet malts.  Very herby through the middle to the finish with a dash of lasting honey sweetness.  Pretty earthy overall with a vague presence of cinnamon.  Light fizzy mouthfeel with a medium level of carbonation; light to medium body.  Interesting herbal and spicy brew.  Not bad.

Bottle from Knightly Spirits. Pours two thumbnails of off-white head with semi-rapid dissipation. Aroma of cola and biscuity malts. More cola, breads and wheat in the flavor. Thin body and medium carbonation. A bit lacking in flavor.

11.2 fl oz swing top bottle purchased at Lukas in Kansas City, Missouri. Bottled on 10.08 code 09.09. Opens with a pop. Pour is hazed orange copper brown with a lasting three inch creamy off white head. Head falls eventually with thick foamy lacing. Aroma of fresh grass, herbal hay and slight lemon citrus element. Under that is an almost minty grain element. The freshness of the nose really surprised me; given the age of this bottle(perhaps I am just misreading the bottled on, perhaps this is August 10th, not October 2008) I was expecting something a bit duller. Taste is clean grain biscuit sweet malt up front, followed quickly by the grass hay herbal and citrus of the nose. The finish has some nice yeast character to it, showing some clove and spice. Palate is medium, with active carbonation. Really satisfying and easy to drink.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2012 hazy amber with a thick bubbly beige head. a soft medium-full body with medium carbonation.

aroma: sulfur, sour (lemon juice) minerality, overripe mango.

taste: sweet biscuity and caramel malt, orange creamsicle, sour minerality, and a bit of pretzel.

very balanced and flavorful. a great after work or with dinner beer.
On draught.  Cloudy brown pour with a medium frothy off white head.  Aroma of malt, caramel and smoke.  Taste of bacon, yeast, malt and faint spices.  Lasting slightly bitter smokey finish.

Pours a hazy brownish red ting with a big fluffy Uerige style head. The aroma is of coffee, milk chocolate, light caramel, and some herbal hops. The flavor is nicely hoppy (noble of course) with some mild but pleasant mineral character and a good roastiness. The beer is largely dry with little hints of caramel sweetness. I think I like this just slightly less than the regular alt, but I rated them the same so perhaps a side by side is warranted.

Bottle. Deep amber to brown. Perfumy, fruity aroma. Nuts and bananas. Belgian notes galore. Dry, sourish taste. Hints of apple. Not the most sharp and fresh beer aroud, but more like a mediocre hombrebrew. Probably not the freshest hops in this one.
Draft. Pours deep, dark brown Thick, full beige head. Aroma of cherries, roasted malts, hops, and barley. Heavy body with a strong, creamy finish. Very good altbier.

a hallucinating patient broke my back in 3 places .. . berry and molasses .. great foam .. molasses again .. . quite a bit of yeasties .. . flavorful yet muted.. heard it needs to be uber fresh to be great .. good, like thumbs..

Serving: 330 ml bottle.
Appearance: Orange-brown with a large, rocky, off-white head.  Great head retention.
Aroma: A little fruity from the hops, nuts and grain notes from the malt.  Fairly mild overall.
Taste:Grainy with notes of caramel malt, light fruit notes, and perhaps a touch of wood.
Palate: Medium carbonation with a light, dry mouthfeel and a medium-short finish.
Overall: I was told this is pretty much a dead on alt.  If so, I am a fan.  I found this one to be quite drinkable and would definitely recommend giving it a go.
Bottle.  Clear light reddish brown pour, with thin off-white head.  Dark fruits, nuts, sweet malt, caramel, and toasted bread.  Light mouthfeel.  Nice beer.
Bottle 33 cl. Clear orangey brown with an off-white head. Aroma of roasted malt and nuts. Medium body, fairly roasted malty, notes of nuts and caramel balanced by a fairly hoppy finish. 100709

Dark brown pour with a small white head. Aroma holds some definite fruity esters, grain and wheat malt, and some nuttiness, especially almonds. Flavor has lots of dry malt, grain, almond, hazelnut, and a bit of caramel. The fruitiness provides an interesting second layer to the overall character of the taste. Palate isn¬ít thick, but the flavor lingers very nicely, and the finish is pretty dry. A good brew.

Dark brown pour with a half finger beige head. Bottle was a bit of a gusher. Aroma is grainy with some light fruity esters and a nutty note. Flavor is roasty malt grain, light nectar fruit, and ogeat. Dry and fruity. Palate is medium with a semi-dry, sweet and coating finish that lingers with sweet nutty malted barley. Pretty unique and delicious.

bottled 10/08, rated 08/09. swingtop to shaker pint. aroma is dark almost smoky caramel. very nice head sits atop very cloudy amber, nearly brown, beer. flavor is of yeast and malty caramel, but without displaying much sweetness. a bit grainy in the finish. in the war of kolschs against alts, im an alt-man all the way, and this beer is one example.
bottle via trade with koelschstrinker, dark brown with lasting tan head, nice aroma of fruity , malt and caramel, flavor is excellent bitter fruit, old wine, woody with lasting finish

Bottle; poured a dirty, muddy, murky, brown color with a big head.  Took forever to finish the pour.  Nice looking.  Aroma of toasted bread, caramel, with some earth, fruit and yeast.  Flavor had a much more pronounced herb and spice presence; the hops shine through nicely to compliment a rich caramel and bready presence.  Palate was very nice, with a touch of softness.  Really nice version of the style.

33 cL bottle, from Pizza Port Carlsbad bottleshop. Pours cloudy dark orange with a small off-white head. Aroma is mild spiced and roasted malt. Flat malty flavoured with a light bitterness coming through. Light roasted and mild acidic flavoured finish.

330 mL sweet flip-top bottle. Poured a deep, muddy brown with an enormous four-finger, tan, rocky head probably due to a little bottle refermentation. Little yeast particulates in the glass. Leaves some excellent lacing. Aroma is dried Saaz hops, herbal hops, caramel, black peppercorn, caramel, pumpernickel bread. Taste is earthy, caramel malt with some pepper and with a large presence of bittering hops leaving some pine resin notes. Finishes with some fruity esters. Would be the ultimate session beer were it cheaper.

Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a lazing off-white head. The aroma is sweet with notes of metal and honey. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, honey, and metal, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottle, Wurstkuche.  Pours amber-brown with a large white head.  Aroma is very grassy and herbal, suggesting significant European hops (Saaz, Hallertau) in this brew.  Flavor starts with herbs and earthiness upfront, moving nimbly towards a balanced mid-body of malt and dry bitterness.  Finish leans dry and semisweet.  A solid altbier.

Pours a cloudy brown color with a sticky tan head that leaves plenty of lacing. Sticky(e) and thick sweet caramel and malts aroma. Pretty bitter and malty. Palate is thick and sticky. Creamy texture to it. This is like what a German IPA would taste like. The only bad thing about this beer is the price.

Bottle from City Beer in SF.  Pours dark brown with a large, lasting off-white head.  Malty aroma with caramel and brown sugar.  Flavor is lots of caramel malt, oak, very slight fruity notes, and mild hops.  Smooth palate, medium-full body.  Good for the style.

On tap at the brickstore. Pours a clean brown color with a big off white head that fades fast. Aromas of big malt, caramel, and bread. As it warms the texture of this thing gets really grainy and chewy malt. Pretty dry with a hint of bittering hops on the finish. The story here though is the malt and grain experience which is well worth the time and money on this one.

Dark amber or medium brown, with a low head. Aroma of sherry, well aged, a bit of fruit, especially dark fruit, and hops. Very sherry-like flavor, with cherries, caramel, and good hops. Tastes oaky and well aged. Much like a British old ale. Very well hopped, with a dry finish of hops and sherry. Nice, but not as good as the regular that I had fresh. The sherry-like aged flavor and aroma are a little too much. A very interesting strong alt. quite different indeed from the regular one. Rich and nice.

Bottle 50cl. w. swing top @ home.[ Trade by Koelschtrinker ]. Clear medium cola brown color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, light beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, caramel, sweet malt, sugar, pepper, light alcohol. Flavor is light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, and a light peppery - alcoholic burn in the finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is soft, finsh feel is light alcoholic. [20090311]

11.2 oz flip top bottle.   Poured into a kolsch glass (which may be sacrilege), got a big slightly off white head which receded quickly with some lacing.  The color is a murky brown, and this beer is really easy to gulp down quickly.  A nice bready malt taste with a little hoppiness and drying finish.

Pours a murky brown with a large, active off-white heat, which simmers down to a lasting film of bubbles and a network of lace.  Aroma is faint, what¬ís there is resinous nuts, a bit of caramel.  Flavor begins with resinous malts and hops bitterness, a lot of nuts and tea here. Some frutiness accompanies the alcohol warmth later on, but the beer remains lightly bitter throughout, with the nuts remaining on the linger. Warm on the palate, very soft and sudsy.  Good, but missing the caramel that makes the ordinary Uerige alt such a wonderful sessionable malt bomb.

On tap at Oldsmar Tap House.  Pours a slightly murky brown color with an off-white head.  Biscuity malt aroma mixed with an assortment of spices.  Low carbonation with a creamy mouthfeel.  Good mixture of flavors with caramel and malt sweetness in the forefront.  Nice aftertaste.

Pours cloudy brown with white head. It¬ís got lots of little particles suspended throughout. Doughy aroma with some spices. Caramel malt flavor. Medium body with tongue tingling carbonation. Decent and interesting.

Mousy brown color, clear until the sediment is poured in. Lingering beige cap. Sweet doughy aroma, cookie dough with raisins. Low carbonation, very soft mouthfeel. Interesting flavors, the bitterness is pronounced of the herbal, spicy zone. The sweet malt balances it out. Very interesting brew, can¬ít wait to visit Dusseldorf...

11.2oz flip top bottle. Possibly the coolest bottle ever. Interesting beer. Pours a hazy brown with lots of sediment. A bit pricey but worth checking out at least for a taste. Looking forward to trying doppel sticke.

Bottle from BOTW. I picked it up from the store the same week it arrived and it was already about 6 months after the bottling date. Bottled 10.08.  The pour is a hazy amber with a white head of tight bubbles. Aroma is malty and spicy and a touch doughy. Flavors are a touch bitter and spicy. Definitely easy to drink, but not as special as I would have anticipated. Perhaps the age has dulled this one. It¬ís really a shame that we in states can¬ít get European beers faster.
On tap at Brick Store Pub, Decatur Georgia. Caramel colored pour. Malty, biscuity aroma. Taste was underwhelming but clean. Caramel malts, some fruitiness. Balanced but not terribly exciting
deep murky brown under a huge rocky tan head.  malty, bready, caramel aroma. flavors are earthy malts and caramel.  medium bodied.  not bad but this has nothing on doppel sticke...the altbier beast.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2014 Small flip top bottle, popped the top and got a good poof!  I was not expecting that, gave a hazy ruby brown pour with a one to two finger off-white creamy foamy head that receded to a thin cover, left some lacing on the glass, aroma of bread, faint caramel and grass, flavor of bread, dark bread, some malt sweetness, some fruit, there is a pronounced hop bitterness and dryness on the palate at the finish, hop bitterness lingers for a bit on the tongue to, nice drink.

"Odd flip top shaped bottle 11.2 oz. In a big 22 oz shapely beerglass. Hazy lighter brown color. Farmy musty barnyard olfactory with a strong alky base aroma of caramel and sweet candy. Oooh, quite a strong initial alky experience. Rather nock you off your pleasant contentment feeling. Rather strong initially, did I say that already? Aroma gets more farmlike as the session continues. Definately a stronger beer but it becomes more acceptable as the session moves past the inception. inish is surprisingly acceptable for a stronger beer. leaves an overal good experience. S6L4F2T4O12"

text:
2002 bottle courtesy of retorp. 
Pours clear brown with thin white head.
Aroma is fruity and has a damn enjoyable sugary nose.
Taste malty, caramel with a light hoppy mouthfeel reminding me of a pilsner. Light touch of dark fruits - cherry -
A fine Altbier

great session beer, if only it were cheaper. I can¬ít justify the $8 purchase  of a bottle of this, but oddly enough I found a bottle for $3 at a beer bar. Lots of malts here, and not many hops to balance it. It tastes pleasantly full and lightly alcoholic. Exactly the type of beer I could have 8 of in one night and not tire from it. Nice caramel taste to it.
On tap @ Redlight.  Cloudy opaque leather color with a thin, even, very light tan head.  Light grainy aroma, slight nuttiness, slight earthy hops.  Nice smooth taste - heavy, spicy malts.
A spicy rasin feel to this amber brown colored beer.. taste is complex in nature and has a nice crisp finish.. Enjoy

On tap at the Bavarian Lodge, Lisle, Il. Properly served in an altbier glass. Dark amber hue with a diminishing, white head and thick, solid lacing. The aroma had a touch of yeast, floral, and light fruit notes. The flavor also adds a nice malt and dryness combo. The mouthfeel is crisp and clean, with lively carbonation.

Bottle, John‚Äôs Grocery, Iowa City, Iowa. Very unusual yellow-rusty pour, small white layer of fine head. Mint, candied orange, blood, earth. Fine, salty/dry bitterness, with a woody, old fruitcake finish. Very refreshing, and I dig the dryness, but overall it feels a little bit dull. Maybe a fresher example would have more life.

On tap at the Oldsmar Tap House (Tampa, FL). Pours a dark brown hazy color with a frothy white head. Aroma is malty and sweet with notes of hops, phenol, honey and slight notes of raisins and ripe dark fruit. Flavor is also sweet and malty with notes of ripe dark fruit, raisins, hints of prunes, caramel, and spice. Generally medium body with a sweet and malty finish.

Crushed with Jakebra.  Surprised this one is only 6.5 abv.  So much body it feels like it has to be higher.  Very bitter but also compllex flavor.  Gives me a bit more faith in Uerige after the last two Ive tried.

bottle, d√≠ky pivnizube! Dark brwon colour, slightly hazy, medium-sized beige head. Intensive malty nose. Full-bodied, intensively malty and hoppy at the same time. Typical Altbier flavours, but more intensive than usual. Hints of chocolate, nuts and raisins. Resiny-grassy hops balance this off. A delicious brew.

Draft at Redlight Redlight.  Pours a hazy, dark, orange-amber color.  A foamy, off-white head settles slowly, sticky bands of lacing remaining behind to coat the glass.  Aromas include caramel, dried fig, raisin, and hints of strawberry and red apple.  A decent helping of floral, earthy hops is there, lending balance to the nose.  Flavors show more of the same, floral hops turning peppery and spicy, lending further bitterness and depth to the caramel and dried fruit notes.  There might be a hint of candied nuts within, as well.  The mouthfeel is substantial and moderately carbonated, finishing kind of dry and yeasty.  This is a very nice Alt.

draft at redlight redlight.  Hoppy, piney nose with caramel malt notes.  Pours a golden amber with a thick white head.  Hoppy bitterness is the first flavor to assert itself.  Rich caramelly malts come next, caramelized sugars, finishes with an almost lager-like bite, very crisp finish.  Very enjoyable, and fresh tasting.
Draft at Redlight.  Pours an amber color with a corn, grain and brown sugar smell.  Taste is slightly sweet and slightly bitter from the hops.  Good beer.

Bottle. Dark brown color with deep red hues and a very bubbly medium-sized head. Aroma of toasted malt, nuts, fruits, light floral hints and some slightly herbal hops. Sweetish malty flavor with some toasted bread, caramel, nuts (including some chestnut notes) and a bitter herbal finish with faint earthy notes. Medium-bodied. A good quaffable beer, I hope I‚Äôll get to try some more Stickes in the future.

33 cl. Bottled on 02,11. Code 1202. Lightly hazy chestnut with a lasting eighth-inch cream. Frosting all over the glass. Aroma of cocoa, plum, apple and earth-spiced molasses. Front flavors of raisin and apple coated in caramel, chocolate and some earthy spice. Slowly turns more roasty with cocoa, toasted nut and woody flavors that provide a nice bittersweet finish. Medium body is smooth, lightly tingly and finishes dry.

Pours a very murky brown in color.  Very little head on the pour.  Only a ring of froth around the edges.  Smell is very caramel and port like.  Age has done this beer wonders.  Very creamy and very dark malts.  Plenty of aged sherry like port in the flavor.  This was a huge surprise.  Very well done.
Hazy golden orange brown color with a finger of off white head.  Nutty, fruity, yeasty breadiness and malt.  Body is heavy malts, more plums and almond nuttiness.  Then a slight bitter finish.

Bottle.  Dark hazy brown pour with a bit of floating sediment.  The date indicated this bottle was at least a year old.  Fluffy off white head and great lacing. German hops and malty caramel on the nose and tongue.  Dirty/earthy notes.  Bitter finish.  Not as sweet as I expected.  Certainly quite different from the Doppel Sticke.

[Bottled on 27.10]   Pours a murky dark amber with a with a small but thick creamy off-white frothy head.  Grassy aroma with notes of oxidized malt.  Grassy and earthy flavors, light chewy toasted crystal malt, faintly nutty,  a bit of toffee.   Unusually sweet in that its overall a dry beer.   Medium body, sugary and a bit gritty, with soft fluffy carbonation.   I like the doppel-sticke but I think this bottle is probably a bit past its prime.

Funky cool bottle.  Took a while to figure out whether this was the Sticke or the Alt... but the Uerige website was helpful.  Pour is a medium brown with a fairly large head at first (almost a light brown color) but it has all but died in the time it took me to figure out which beer this was.  Aromas are earthy, with sweetness that is brown sugar and dates.  Flavor is odd... I expected things to be sweet from the aroma, but there is a sharp bitter edge throughout, and the finish is especially jagged.  Allmost comes off as peat on the finish.  This is an odd beer that just doesn‚Äôt work for me.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Cloudy dark brown with a thin off-white head. Pleasantly earthy hop aroma. taste is malty with a strong undercurrent of bitterness and a dark, spicy hop finish. Very earthy and solid. Very tasty.

Pop top bottle- Amber brown pour with a tan foam head.  Aroma of brown sugar, dark fruits, caramel.  Smooth on the palate and malty but with a bit of a dry aftertaste and tinge of bitters.  Good Alt and good flavor, a little bitter and earthy on the back end.

Bottle shared by the_Captain. ver complex aroma of brown sugar, malt, dark fruit and b yeast. Didn‚Äôt really taste like it smelled but got better as it got warmer. Nice hazy brown color with an off white creamy head. tasted like brown sugar and grass or earthy notes. My only complaint was that it was very very dry. Kind of reminded me of an English bitter but very dry finish. Good brew though.

Bottle shared by The_Captain. Thanks Mark. Pours hazy brown with a foamy tan head. Smells of dough, caramel, brown sugar, dark fruit. After smelling it I was expecting a rich, complex flavor but all I really tasted was an earthy bitter dough flavor. It was good, just not as amazing as I was expecting after reading reviews of it.

(GERMAN) Pours a hazy amber / brown color with a med-tan head. The aroma is of dry fruits, brown sugar, and pepper. Taste is kind of hoppy with a roasted walnut flavor !! The finish is dry and very drinkable, nice lacing too. I must say that i enjoyed this brew very much. :)

initially, I got an nose of cherry, but it further developed into a bit of a fig aroma, with some hints of "other fruit" tartness.  Upon an initial sip, fig definitely stands out as the dominant flavor.  It a very good beer with deep, rich fruit flavors.  I¬ím not quite sure what I was getting, but it was dark, rich, and bold.   A very rich brew.

11.2oz bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy, tea-brown color; huge, light-khaki head with good retention and glistening, creamy lacing; a great pour.  Solid presence of candy sugar and soft brown sugar in the aroma, with a crisp mineral bitterness; clean, fresh nose.  Medium mouthfeel: crisp upfront mineral / earthy hop character and a solid maltiness: candy sugar, breadiness, and tea; strikes a good balance between malt-forward and solid, crisp drinkability; a very pleasant example of the style.  Medium finish: dry breadiness, toasted malts, and candy sugar; a touch of lingering sweetness and zesty minerals.

Taste 7/8.  Looks: Dark red body with a white clinging head. Aroma: Sweet Malt, roast and straw. Taste: Spicy, sticky, light to medium body. Quite a lot of ingredient. Tasty. Full flavored and easy  to drink.

Bottle: Pours a dark mahogany color with a light white head and nice bubbly lacing. Clean mild sugars and caramel malts, plums, nice light melanoidins and a subtle roastiness that blends all this sweetness and light noble hops together. Balanced malty mouthfeel. Creamy body and a smooth mouthfeel. Meaty and juicy altbier.
Nice altbier. Malty. Sweet. Germans know their altbier. Thanks to Thomas for this one. Went down well.

Bottle from Once Upon a Vine North in Richmond. Clear brown pour with a medium head and good lacing. Very strong grain aroma with a hint of bitterness. Big grain taste w/ dark fruit notes, nuttiness, and big bitterness.

11.2 ounce bottle from By The Bottle in Vancouver, WA--Poured a very dark amber body with a fluffy thin whitish head.  Raisin, dark fruit, creamy, malty sweet, sticky sticke.  Some brown sugar and fruity hops in the finish.  Lots of caramel all the way through.  Quite good.

Not only is the beer inside the bottle very good, the bottle itself is unique and very eyecatching. Shaped like a German handgrenade, the beer won¬ít blow up the taste buds with anything unusual, but it you will be happy that you took the time to drink this. An aroma of sweet caramel malts, earthy hops, slightly nutty, and a bit oxidized. A ruddy brown, hazy color with a 1-finger thick head. Caramel malts, grassy with just a touch of spices makes this one a drinker. Reminded me of a subdued English barleywine in some ways. Very tasty beer. I enjoyed this one much more than their Dopple Sticke.

Uerige Sticke¬ís distinctively craggy bottle and its ambiguously pointed super "U" give it a prominent place on the beer shelf no matter what height it sits at.  The long, gun-barrel pour whips up a clotted and webby head, its many bubbly threads clinging tenuously to the glass.  The acorn colored liquor is murky and hazy, hinting at a well developed and assertive flavor.  Verification comes in the aroma where an array of spices affix themselves to strong and obstreperous flavors - cinnamon with honey, raisin with leather, all-spice with wildflower.  The alcohol is strong too, accentuating the stinging leather flavor to a chemical burn.  The obligatory hops profile merges with the spices to produce Uerige¬ís distinctive tongue raking sensation, but is subtly tamed by a droplet or two of white grape juice sweetness.  Despite the Uerige¬ís aromatic assault, furiously engaging the olfactory with a barrage of intense, pungent rounds, the flavor is unusually plain and neutral.  A quick dip of the tongue in the beer invokes a springtime flowerbed, tempered by an unexpected cloud of chalk and dust.  This transmogrifies what would otherwise be a nice, pure floral note into a aged, senescent potpourri - not too palatable.  Hops and grapefruit escort Uerige the rest of the way to a brief aftertase, after which the beer¬ís extravagant carbonation muddles any remaining flavor, criss-crossing the taste with cutting bubbles.  It is yet another case of a beer¬ís internecine flavor profile, with an over eager carbonation vying against the delicate flavors for control of the palate.  The carbonation almost always wins.  With a mouthfeel wresting control of the flavor and hijacking my tastebuds I can¬ít help but think the beer is a bit of a bust, but let me tell you, the bottle makes an incredible infused oil container for those of you who are culinarily inclined.  Might even be worth the pricetag.

It is rich and lighty syrupy.  Finish is lightly spicy with a touch of sourness and anise.  Very well done alt.

Bottle thanks to Willblake at the NYRBG. Clear, light brown color with a small beige head. Aroma is mildly sweet malts, buttery toffee and some nuttiness. Flavor is buttery, sweet malts, nuts and a hint of hops in the background. Very creamy mouthfeel.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2008 Rerate. Bottled on 02.11. Code 12 02.  Clear amber orange with a 1 1/2 finger off-white head, great retention.  Aroma has some spicy citrus--not necessarily Pac NW hops--up front with lots of sweet toffee and caramel malts.  A bit earthy and dry.  The flavor adds a bit of a buttery caramel note and a bit of sulfurous skunkyness.  Earthy dry finish (redundant?) with bitterness that peaked around a 4.  Light to moderate carbonation with a medium body.  Very nice beer, overall.  Old rating follows.  11.2oz., Bottled on 25.11.  Pours a clear copper brown with a moderate, very light beige head.  Aroma of caramel, nuts, grain, a little grass.  Hops make a bigger showing in the taste up front with a fair amount of bitterness.  Creamy, medium body with soft carbonation.  Very nice alt--I¬ím looking forward to their other two alt¬ís.  7-3-7-4-14--3.5
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: 330 ml bottle. Amber coloured with a grayish note to it. No head. Subdued barleywine-like aroma. Musty apple and caramel. Pear syrup and a little vanilla. Noble hops are clearly being used as it infuses the beer with a very gentle, but noticeable, hop flavour. Medium-bodied, and not at all sweet. It¬ís quite dry actually, with a well done hop bitter finish.

No head. Light brownish red body with some haziness. Sweet powerfully floral malty aroma with cinnamon and caramel notes, slightly earthy. Sweet roasty licorice taste with some cinnamon. Very fruity. Intense cinnamon aftertaste. Incredibly delicate and well balanced. Not too powerful, but much better for it. Excellent! Really something special. (0.33l bottle.)

Pours deep clear bronze with a thick, off-white head. Bread, caramel and grassy hops in the nose. Nice foundation of heavy caramel, toffee, then comes a little pear followed by a prominent noble hop presence. Bitter hop finish which lingers for awhile. Bold and flavorful. Medium bodied with a smooth texture and subtle carbonation. Overall, pretty enjoyable.

Finally a gold nugget plucked from my d.b.a. jaunt in NYC.  Yummy, yeasty, bitter-style aroma.  Great embossed latch bottle and woody brown beer.  Buttery, woody, a bit cereal.  Very enjoyable.  Medium long woody finish.  Adequately bittered with lots of character.

12oz bottle from lee¬ís liquor: pours a deep red with very silky smooth looking foam, but not much of it.  some aromas going on i can¬ít quite identify, but good.  fantastic flavor from the dark malts and hops, they hit the nail right on the head.  powerful flavor, but not at all overpowering and a very tasty drink and a very distinct aftertaste.  i¬íll be getting more of this.. plus i like the bottles. ;)

Bottle date 31-01. Sweet fermented aroma. Cloudy brown with small head. Flavor is heavy dose of alcohol and sweet but mellows out conciderably by the finish with a carmelized crystalation of sorts. Sugary and sweet aftertaste and cool bottle. Good brew.
11 oz bottle-pours a creamy tan head with red color.  Aroma is malt.  Taste is malt, roasty, sweet.  Caramel and hops finish.  OK carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2006 An enjoyable alt, although the alcohol was a tad more noticeable than I would have preferred. Poured a nice clear orange-brown with a moderate head that laced quite well. Aroma was somewhat hoppy (not floral, though) with a buttery smell. Flavor was sweet (molasses or brown sugar works for me, I couldn¬ít place it on my own) with a nice hoppy finish. The mouthfeel is a little heavier than I expected but refreshing (low carbonation). August ¬í06 update: only available on-site in October and Jan or February, two times a year.

Bigger, brawner version of the classic Dusseldorf altbier. Like alt, this beer has fantastic hop aroma, clean maltiness, and a zesty and snappy hop bite. Uerige Sticke pours to a beautiful, bright, deep copper color, with a thick white head, and a good carbonation. The nose on this beer is excellent, with lots of good herbal/grassy hop aromas, and aromas of toast and nuts. The palate is smooth and round, with clean, smooth toasty and nutty malt flavor. Uerige Sticke finishes with more smooth malt up front, then ends with a zesty burst of herbal/grassy hop bittereness that lingers. I love this beer style, and Uerige to me is the bench mark example of sticke and alt. A must try beer for anyone who loves altbier.

330ml swingtop bottle poured a clear amber with a lasting light amber head. Aromas of dates, brown sugar and bread. palate was light bodied. Flavors of carmel, a bit of toffee, raisins and a hint of brown sugar with a smooth lingering bittersweet finish.

Pour is a dark brown with a big soapy looking head.  Aroma is wonderful.  Very bready and dark fruits with s ton of malt.  Flavor is also very nice.  Some rasions and plum with toffee and caramel mixed in.  Very tasty and prob one of the best alt¬ís i have ever had.

Pours an amber copper color with a shallow creamy froth. Comes in a bottle shaped like a German granade. Aroma is of malted biscuits. Very nice. I am already impressed. I am waiting to take a sip. Trying to imagine the texture and flavor. Here I go. WOW, not knowing what to expect at all, this has turned into a very surprising result. I am still impressed. Flavors are dry and malty with a fresh biscuit tropshire. A creamy texture like an English bitter. A nicely ballanced sour bittering on the finish. This is a brew you can drink all day. Well ballanced, alcohol is well hidden and flavors are perfect. I love it when the bitterness is consumed with a malty backbone. Keeps you hanging in the ballance. Highly recommended.
Pours deep brown with small head.  Fruity aroma apple raisin and citrus.  Taste is sweet roasted malts, carmel, raisin.  Light palate with excellent bright flavor.
Bottle. Rich copper color with a nice off-white head. Caramel and earthy aroma. Earthy, caramel flavor with some underlying grassiness and citrus. Medium bodied. Some mineral tones.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2007 Pours a cloudy brown into a farmhouse water glass.  No head whatsoever -- and no evidence of carbonation.  Malt aromas - dates, plums, dough.  Flat, sticky and figgy with a long lasting bitter malt finish.

Sweet malty grapey toffee aroma, a sweet but not overly so taste,that reminded me of a non tart sugary  iced tea,texture was surprisngly smooth,I thought it was wonderful,almost hated to take that last sip. Fantastic brew,fabulous bottle.

Excellent packaging, nice dark semieffervescent liquid in the glass, looks good, brown turbinado sugar in the nose, touch of toffee, sweet carmels on the tongue balanced something  tart and cidery. Interesting. It¬ís not real lively or hoppy or smokey but still plain, obvious and curious.
Dark, almost black, with a head that quickly fades.  Heavy malt aroma with a slight mustyness.  Heavy and sweet.
user_location: People¬ís Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text:
UPDATED: OCT 1, 2009 From the beautiful bottle, with a nice burst of pressure upon opening.
The beer pours a cloudy amber with a beautiful head and lacing. The aroma is subdued, hinting at the caramel malts and grassy hops that will delight the tongue. The flavor is mellow but absolutely lovely -- warm malt, caramelized pears, a hint of pepper, iron, and a soft rounded bitter hop finish. The mouthfeel is both rich and refreshing, and overall the beer is a great pleasure to drink. What a nice brew!

From an attractive 11,2 oz distinctively shaped swing top brown bottle with a coded bottled on date on neck label, 31.01. Made a good appearnace, poured a amber hued brown with a fizzy, bubbly pale tannish head. Had a nice tasty aroma, raisins and dark fruits, a little citric, and a sweet bready maltiness with whiffs of alcohol. Good carbonation and a slick, smooth light bodied mouth feel, good drinkability. Very tasty, raisins and citric fruity, a little piney, a nice hop bite on the tongue, an underlining bready maltiness, a dry sour fruity finish with a lingering alcohol burn in the palate.
Thick raison brown colored. Has a fairly complex sweet flavor. Probably wouldnt pick it up again, but certainly not bad., Just not a favorite style for me.

This altbier pours a deep brown color from a 330ml swing top bottle. Small to medium sized white foamy head. Aroma is caramel and earthy. A medium bodied altbier. Malts are caramel and sweet. Some floral and earthy flavors are balanced by a touch of spiciness and grassiness. Nice carbonation. Smooth taste with a nice dry finish. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is crisp and dry. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

I¬ím pretty sure this is October 2005. Pours a deep amber color with a fairly thick white head. German hops are dominate and compliment an apple like malt aroma. I enjoy the flavor of this beer but it is not incredibly complex. Bitter german hops and a sweet malt backing make this easy to drink and thirst-quenching as water in hell. Solid offering.

When I popped the top on this one, it smelled like beer.  Pretty straightforward stuff.  The taste was nothing to write home about but did satisfy adequately for an Altbier.  Amber hued, foamy head.  Some sweetness and altogether easily drinkable.

Bottled Jan 31, and it wasn¬ít 2006. I think this one might have passed. Copper body with almost no head. Aroma has malty notes of caramel, bread and also some grass. Not impressive at all though, seems timid. Flavor is even worse, flat, stale, just... blah. I¬íll rerate it if I can find a fresh bottle, it¬ís probably pretty good.

Gigantic foamy billowing head.  The swing top actually popped and spritzed almost like champagne.  Altbier?  Seasonal?  Hmm ... hops presence on the nose with a sly mix of sweeter malt.  Good combo - almost like a solid IPA mixed with a top brown sweet ale.  Sharp clear tawny hue.  Fresh crisp finish.  Cool sleek unique looking bottle.  Enjoyable bier!

Light white head with a ruby body.  Sweet aroma similar to the Stone Double Bastard.  Hops and malts are very present in it.  Sharp initial taste with a slight caramel flavoring.  Some bitterness typical of German beers in the ending.
Clear amber color with a thick creamy white head. Aroma of malt with hints of honey. Sweet flavor with light hops.

Very hoppy though light aroma much like an APA, though with touches of eastern european hops. Pours burnt orange with nice though fizzy head. Taste doesn¬ít match up with APA so much as a pilsner in that it has nice hopping but a balanced hop backbone that is medium thickness though still assertive.
Bottle. Had this a while back, am now updating my "rated" list. Poured a nut-brown, nutty pleasant aroma. Had a good head, and excellent flavour. Another very drinkable beer!

Pours slightly haze nut brownwith an off-white head and good head retention.  Nose is of a malty brown with some wood and tobacco notes.  Mouthfeel is medium with moderate carbonation  and a dry finish.  Flavors are more malty than hoppy, nutty with a bit of roast.  Fairly straightforward and pleasant.

Old notes from a tasting last year.  Brown pour, decent head.  Nutty malty aromas, and a bit doughy.  Sweet malty flavors, some dough/bread, some nuts, some wood.  Clean finish.  Fairly enjoyable, and surprisingly bigger than I expected for an altbier.

Bottle shared by <a
href=http://www.ratebeer.com/ViewUser.asp?U target=blank> beerhugger, thanks Steve.  Copper in colour, off-white head (good retention), some lace.  The aroma is malty (cookies, caramel), some citrus hops and some smoke.  The flavour was malty (cookies, bready, caramel), slightly sweet, cirtus hops, nutty.  Bitter mouthfeel, medium body, medium carbonation.  Finishes with a lingering hop bite, dry.  Quite nice.

Actually had this a couple of months ago, just misplaced the rating sheet. Faint aroma, pretty headless. Much lighter taste and pretty malty compared to the doppel. Haps come through only in the aftertaste.  Cloudy amber  color. A decent beer, but no match for the doppelsticke.

Pours a dark copper with minimal head.  Aroma is dry white wine, caramel, thickly malted, a nice stickiness to it, a little nutty I think similar to cashews.  Caramel, slight nuttiness, bitter sting when first hits your tongue then spreads into a semi-sweet chocolate taste.  Palate is kind of light with a subtle stickiness.   Unique experience with a nice Alt.  I wish I had a bigger bottle of this.

Lots of sweet malt in the aroma. Caramel, brown sugar and molasses. Light amber in color with a head that is both creamy and bubbly. Has a deep fruity sweetness in the fore followed by a crisp, but tongue coating flavor of peanut skins. Never come across that before in a beer.

(Bottle, "bottled on 31.01.") Pours a brownish amber with a smallish biege head. Aroma: maltiness plus some brown sugar and caramel. Pretty good lacing. Great body, mouthfeel nice and chewy. Flavor: reserved malt caramel sweetness with some sourishness in finish - don¬ít think this is a bad bottle, so guess the sourishness is supposed to be there.

wow, a very complex drink indeed.  caramel and malty nose, malt & fruits flavor with a very complex semi-sweet tounge as it finished with a unique, sour twist in the finish that quickly dissapears with no aftertaste...  it¬ís really strange, but this is a very, very well put together, unique drink.

Had one of these at the Winking Lizard.  Should have kept the bottle.  Light floral and
fruit notes dominate the subtle but very pleasant nose.  Caramel tones leak out a bit as
brew warms.  The brew pours a dark color characteristic of mahogany or walnut.  The tall
off white frothy head is mostly lasting with good lace character.  The brew starts nice and
malty with moderate acidity and exceptional balance with a nice long full finish.  The
medium creamy and soft body has an astringent feel to the finish.  Exceptional offering.

bottle-thanks whaleman for the recomendation!  pours copper with a small soapy off-white head and sparse lacing.  aromatically, this beer has alot of complexity for the style-carmel, cheeries, fresh cut wood, toasty maltness, some faint cinammon, and spice chracacter with some nice chocolate notes.  nice body-full and slick.  flavors are very malty, chocolate, light bitterness from some earthy hops.  very nice and probably the best alt i have ever had!

33cL flip-top.  Copper and clear.  Medium head.  Big malt aroma, some grassiness and breadiness.  Wow, the flavor is so clean with the big malt and the bitterness at the end is very nice.  Medium body.  It is very well balanced with an excellent palate with just the right carbonation.  Excellent beer!  Can¬ít wait to finally make it to Dusseldorf.

Dark caramel with athin but creamy head.
Metalic, sweet malty aroma.
Flavor is sweet but not overly so, spice, ripe fruits, caramel.
Easy , sweet , creamy finish.

Cloudy amber color,medium sized white head that had a decent hangtime then faded slowly to leave a bit of a lcae behind.The aroma was malty and nicely hoppy with a slight citrusy side to it.I have a cold so it¬ís hard to tell.malty caramel flavor with a nice hop presence and over all not bad at all.Fairly well balanced and smooth,i could go for a few more  of these.

Bottled.  Pour was a hazy medium amber with orange highlights and a tall, creamy beige head.  Fragrant grassy and floral hops meshed with a considerable amount of caramel maltage... very enticing.  Caramel malts and fresh floral hops throughout the flavor, too... along with some nuttiness.  Smooth and medium-bodied at best on the palate, with some hoppy bitterness at the finish.  Quite an enjoyable brew, and Style Rating #70.

bottle from cairo.  low carbonation, pours a cloudy dark amber.  aroma is very mild...malt, some roast?  medium body, decent malty base, but the finish is unpleasantly medicine-y.  this is average at best.

Bottle from Fancy Grocery NYC.  Pours a dark amber with a small white head that diminishes quickly.  Big molasses and grapefriut aroma, with some raisin and toffee back there too.  Wonderful Munich malt flavor, moderately sweet, followed by an avalanche of hop flavor.  What was great about this beer is that just as the malts start to give out, the bitterness kicks in, allowing you to get the best of both, with little blending.  How¬íd they do that?  A real treat.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2010 Dark amber w/ a tight head that diminishes to a nice ring. Very nicely balanced flavor--a deep munich malt richness balanced w/ a floral nobel hop aroma and a good dash of bitterness. Delectably quaffable and an elegant example of the style. Neato bottle too.

A little sweeter and a little fuller than the regular Uerige, with the bitterness in the finish a little more tamped down.  The carbonation seemed low and for the sweetness the mouthfeel tended towards being watery, which was odd.  I¬íd love to have some more caramel taste in here.

Tasted 18th jan. 2005 at the brewery. A very good beer but measured bitterness was only 26 IBU¬ís. All the stories on the internet about higher hoprates and dry hopping are b******t. It has more alcohol than Uerige Alt, but less bitterness.

Bottle. I had first had this beer in Chicago last year. Clear amber with a foamy tan head and lacing. One of the first alt. Beers I have had that is so complex.  Nutty malt and a grassy hop bite. Nice beer.
One of my favorites. Drink slightly chilled or else you won¬ít get the full flavor.

Small rubber stopped brown bottle purchased from Armanetti¬ís, Mundelein, IL. ABV 4.5%.  Hazy brown hued having a small, white diminishing head with good lacing. No discernable aroma. Average carbonation.  Medium bodied dry palette that starts with sharp bitter, alcoholic taste and finishes with moderate bitter of average duration. Slight bottle leakage when bottled stored on side but carbonation and flavor seemed fine.  A good drinkable beer.

Thanks DarkElf!  pours a clear amber color with virtually no head and no lacing at all.  ARoma is extremely full of caramel and hops with hints of grass, quite smooth and enjoyable to the nose.  Flavor is similar, but just not as good as the aroma.  Strong caramel and grass tones through-out with a punch of hops at the end.  I liked this beer, but thought the aroma was better than the flavor.

Direct from the barrel.  Incredibly malt.  You could smell the caramel notes from outside the brewery. Thick body that seemed to melt on the tongue.  Nice hop in the end with bitterness to balance the malt body. Amber color, creamy white head.

at the source from the barrell on the Sticke day!; I never knew Altbier could be so complex. Hoppy nose, with hint of caramel and smoke. Extremely complex palate, a lot of hops and malt, smooth mouthfeel with a kind of hoppy smokey finish. This was extremely good and enjoyed in a great atmosphere at the brewpub.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2005 (bottle and tap at the brewpub, 6%ABV) Clear amber colour with a foamy slightly off-white medium head. Malty, liquorice-spicy and slightly fruity aroma with a hoppy and cinnamon background. Initial sweet maltiness combines very well with the herbal and flowery hoppiness. Extremely well balanced sweet malty and hopbitter finish. What a gem !!!!

Bottle.  Extremely sweet aroma when bottle is popped.  Small white head, brown caramel body.  Strong caramel in aroma, very sweet, some alcohol.  Flavor is not as potent as aroma, but very similar, with alcohol in aftertaste.  I would have guessed that the ABV is much higher than 6.5%.  Fairly good, but could use a little balance, and it seems more like a bock to me.

(330 ml swing-top bottle: $3.69 at Holiday Wine Cellar in Escondido, CA) While not as impressive looking as the regular Uerige Alt, this one is far more tasty, so I¬íll gladly take that trade-off.  Malty, sweet, a bit earthy, only slightly bitter, and showing a pleasant nuttiness and a good bit of smokiness in the finish, this is reminding me of a really malty English ale.  The aromatic nose is malty, earthy and a bit smoky.  Medium in body and lightly carbonated, this goes down all too easy.  Light brown in color, just a shade darker than the Uerige Alt, and slightly hazy in appearance.  Very little actual head develops during or after the pour, just a sheen actually, but there are clumps of large bubbles that form during the pour.  So, not much of a looker, but this is delicious.  It¬ís a beer I just can¬ít help but continuously take small sips, just to keep constantly replentishing that tasty flavor on my tongue.
Poured a golden brown color.  Sweet and fruity with raisins dominating.  Dry finish.  This and the double sticke are nice beers.

Crisp, wonderful body, and brisk hops.  Certainly worth the money, even if you are paying a little extra for the bottle. Truly classic and really unlike anything else coming from germany. Makes me want to rent a flat in Dusseldorf.

Bottle Courtesy of dortmunder. Thanks!BB 13.02 Bottled 14.01 (?!) Shining ruby/amber. Breadlike heavy aroma. Toasted bread. Full bodied. Sticky (!) palate. Sort of Belgian dubbel, bockbier, old ale combo. My first Sticke after 20 years of beer hunting! Too yeasty for my taste, but maybe it is supposed to be like this. Sweet and quite hoppy taste. If it wasn¬ít for yeast, this would be very pleasant. I prefer the "ordinary" alt from this brewery.
Bottled:Very malty, sweet aroma. Aromatic flavor, ester, sweet, fruity. Quite bitter, dry and hoppy finish. Very good beer.

I liked this bottle as well as the other uerige. This sticke was better then the other. Deep rudy with tan head. Good aroma of dark fruits and caramel. Touch of hop to finisf. Smooth mouth feel and good brew.

11.2 oz. bottle.  Pours a deep garnet red with average white head that settles to a film rather quickly.  Aroma is quite good, heavy on malt, with plum, purne, a little bubblegum, and some resiny hop.  Flavor is very nice, very malty with a vinous finish on the first sip.  This has a really long lasting finish due to its mouth coating palate.  Mouthfeel is perfect, just the right amount of carbonation sot that it doesn¬ít interfere with tasting the flavor.  Hop bitterness comes out more as the beer warms and really balances the malt well.  This stuff¬ís pretty awesome, very recommended.

Great bottle, definitely a keeper! Pours maple syrup brown with a quickly settling off-white head. Aroma is rich and inviting with sweet malt presenting itself on a background of floral hops while notes of alcohol drift in and out of the nose. Flavor is sweet and floral; malty with understated hops character and teasing alcohol nibbles. In a word, intoxicating. Uerige Sticke is a fantastic seasonal beer and I feel quite fortunate to have found a bottle this afternoon. This is a beer that I could definitely see myself stocking up on around the holidays.

Bottled on 25.10. Code 11 26
I have to admit, I¬ím a bit of a "bottle whore" and that¬ís what attracted me to this beer...  a well crafted and unique swing-top with sparse labels and a healthy dose of raised lettering in the glass, including a line of braille at the bottom! Excellent!
Appearance was an almost-mahogany body, slightly hazed with a creamy, little head. Aromas were well malted with raisin, honey & caramel over grains and earthiness... an overall impression of a sweet breakfast cereal. Nicely balanced flavors with sweet malts proving dominance. Smooth and slightly thick on the tongue with a touch of alcohol at the end that made me smile. Quite delicious. Hoping to find a bigger bottle.
